title: Anthem for Charles III’s coronation written by Lloyd Webber
description: Andrew Lloyd Webber, the English composer who created the scores for blockbuster musicals such as “Cats,’’ “The Phantom of the Opera’’ and “Evita,’’ has written the anthem for King Charles III’s coronation, adapting a piece of church music that encourages singers to make a “joyful noise.”

title: Suriname: More arrests expected after antigovernment riots
description: Suriname’s government is warning of more arrests and putting police on high alert a day after a protest against the policies of President Chandrikapersad Santokhi spun out of control and hundreds of demonstrators stormed parliament

title: Thousands of civilians fled Ukraine’s front lines. These people returned.
description: Thousands of returnees have partially repopulated the area where Moscow is waging its fiercest fighting intent on seizing the entire Donetsk region as its own.

title: Top U.S., Chinese diplomats hold first meeting since balloon incursion
description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken and China’s top diplomat, Wang Yi met on Saturday in what was the first face-to-face engagement since the spy balloon drama.

title: While world leaders meet in Munich, anti-war demonstrators gather outside
description: Nearly 5,000 police officers have been assigned to manage protests.

title: Israelis protest judicial overhaul plans for 7th week
description: Tens of thousands of Israelis are marching in several cities against judicial overhaul plans proposed by Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s government

title: What are crimes against humanity?
description: U.S. officials formally accused Russia on Saturday of perpetrating crimes against humanity in Ukraine. Here's what that means.

title: Dogs in costumes take over at Rio Carnival street party
description: As Rio de Janeiro kicks off its Carnival, about 100 dogs are barking and wagging their tails to the tune of samba music as they parade in front of pet lovers in a canine costume competition

title: Turkey: Couple saved 296 hours after quake, but children die
description: Turkish state media say a couple and their son were pulled alive from under a collapsed apartment building more than 12 days after a 7.8 magnitude earthquake ravaged parts of Turkey and Syria

title: Bulgaria detains 7 over deaths of 18 migrants found in truck
description: Authorities in Bulgaria have detained seven people in connection with an abandoned truck in which 18 people believed to be migrants were found dead

title: Spanish court rules against holiday homes that hired guards to enforce nudity
description: Holiday home owners in a popular nudist area hired guards to stop clothed residents using the pool. Spain's Supreme Court says it was discrimination.

title: From a secret safehouse, Peru's Indigenous revolt advances
description: Peruvian Indigenous activists have gotten a jolt of self-confidence from the movement demanding the resignation of interim President Dina Boluarte

title: Russia has committed war crimes in Ukraine, Harris declares
description: Speaking before the Munich Security Conference, Harris said that the world has a humanitarian and strategic interest in continued support of Ukraine

title: US: Russia has committed crimes against humanity in Ukraine
description: U.S. Vice President Kamala Harris says Washington has determined that Russia has committed crimes against humanity in Ukraine

title: North Korea fires long-range missile after threatening actions against U.S.
description: The missile could have been one of North Korea’s powerful intercontinental ballistic missiles with the capability of reaching the U.S. mainland, according to Japanese officials.

title: Death toll from Islamic State attack in Syria at least 53
description: Syria’s state media and an opposition war monitor say the death total from an attack by the Islamic State group against an army checkpoint and people collecting wild truffles in central Syria has risen to at least 53

title: Iran International moves shows to Washington, citing threats
description: A Farsi-language satellite news channel based in London long critical of Iran’s theocractic government says it has moved its broadcasts to Washington “to protect the safety of its journalists” after reportedly being targeted by Tehran

title: UK's Sunak set to say security guarantees need for Ukraine
description: British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak is expected to call on world leaders to “double down” on support for Ukraine, saying arms and security guarantees are needed to protect the country and the rest of Europe from Russian aggression now and in the future

title: Defense minister: Finland could join NATO ahead of Sweden
description: Finland’s defense minister says his country will join NATO without waiting for Sweden if its Nordic neighbor’s accession is held up by the Turkish government

title: U.K. woman’s disappearance prompts wave of amateur ‘TikTok detectives’
description: Self-appointed sleuths are looking for Nicola Bulley in the village of St. Michael’s on Wyre.

title: Before Fetterman, many politicians have disclosed mental health problems
description: Australian and Norwegian prime ministers and U.K. lawmakers have discussed their depression and other struggles, amid increasing openness around mental health.

title: Brazil’s first minister of Indigenous peoples starts job amid crises
description: Guajajara’s appointment was heralded, but after four years of Jair Bolsonaro, her task will be enormous. She insists she's up to the job.

title: Turkish teen filmed 'last moments' from quake-hit apartment
description: When the earthquake hit Adiyaman, in southern Turkey, Taha Erdem was buried under tons of debris

title: Soccer player Christian Atsu found dead after Turkey quake, agent says
description: Former Premier League soccer player Christian Atsu was missing after the earthquakes. He had played for Turkey's Hatayspor and on Ghana’s 2014 World Cup team.

title: South Korea says North Korea fires missile into sea
description: South Korea’s military says North Korea has fired at least one ballistic missile into the sea

title: United front in Congress on Ukraine, at least in Munich
description: U.S. lawmakers seek to drown out the vocal right-wing conservatives who are critical of American support for Ukraine against Russian aggression.

title: Philippine plane with 4 aboard goes missing, search underway
description: A small plane carrying four people has gone after taking off southeast of the Philippine capital and a search is underway

title: U.S. suspends search for objects shot down over Alaska and Lake Huron
description: In a statement issued late Friday, U.S. Northern Command said “search activities have discovered no debris” from either encounter.

title: Grieving Ukrainian mom finds refuge in UK, but little solace
description: Viktoria Kovalenko saw the death of her husband Petro and 12-year-old daughter Veronika last March when the car they were in was hit by a shell in northern Ukraine

title: Ukraine invasion reshaped global alliances, renewed fears
description: Nearly a year after Russia invaded Ukraine, the diplomatic consequences of the war still reverberate worldwide

title: Inside the Taliban campaign to forge a religious emirate
description: Afghanistan’s new rulers are replacing civil rights with ‘God’s law,’ by gutting the justice system and packing the jails.

title: Ukraine live briefing: Ukrainian unit fresh from U.S. training returns to battle; Harris to address Munich forum
description: The first Ukrainian unit to undergo U.S. combat training in Germany is returning to combat ahead of Russia's anticipated spring offensive, the Pentagon said.

title: India welcomes 12 cheetahs from South Africa
description: India has welcomed 12 cheetahs from South Africa that will join eight others it received from Namibia last year as part of an ambitious drive to reintroduce the big cats in the country after 70 years

title: Over 30,000 Wagner Group fighters killed or injured in Ukraine, U.S. says
description: Some 9,000 members of the Russian mercenary group — many of them convicts — have been killed in the invasion of Ukraine, the White House said.
